by Graham Williams

Section E CTAN Edition

Welcome to the XML based and XSL generated version of The TeX Catalogue Online, Section E CTAN Edition. This is a listing of entries in the TeX Catalogue and may take a little time to load, but is hopefully worth it. Have a look at the Catalogue Preface for alternative ways of accessing the catalogue.

The TeX Catalogue Online is also available from any CTAN node or mirror, including the following. Pick one that is close to you. (The "search" link attempts to find a CTAN node that may be close to you, courtesy of Randy Kobes. Multiple clicks may find alternatives.)



search

aarnet

switch

cstug

dante

loria

tex

roma

riken

gust

rge

ctan

Icons associated with many entries in the catalogue allow you to:

  • view the directory on CTAN
  • view documentation (possibly many)
  • view documentation in PDF format (requires the acroread plugin)
  • jump to the package's home page
  • download a gzip'd tar file from a nearby CTAN node (not supported by all nodes)
  • download a gzip'd tar file from ftp.dante.de

Other icons simply provide further information about the package:

  • part of the teTeX distribution
  • available on the TeX Live CD ROM

The license type, version (if known), and the date of the last change made to each particular Catalogue entry are also provided.

This compilation Copyright (c) 1998, 1999 Graham J. Williams. Last modified 1999/05/13.

Use of these web documents and information contained herein is subject to the CSIRO Legal Notice and Disclaimer.

ean Font for making EAN barcodes.
See also barcodes code128
license: gpl (1999/03/03)
easy A collection of ``easy'' to use macros.
See also easyeqn easyvector easybmat easymat easytable easybib
license: lppl version: 0.9 (1999/03/31)
easybib Simple syntax for custom bibliographies.
A macro package for writing custom bibliographies with a simple AMS-TeX -like syntax. See also easy
license: lppl version: 0.7 (1999/03/31)
easybmat Block matricies.
A simple package for writing block matrices with equal column widths or equal rows heights or both, with various kinds of rules between rows and columns. See also easy
license: lppl version: 0.8 (1999/03/31)
easyeqn A simple package for writing equations.
Introduces some equation environments that simplify writing of equations. It uses a syntax similar to the array environment to define the column alignment. A package option causes only those equations that were labeled and referenced to be numbered. A set of macros for typesetting is also added. See also easy
license: lppl version: 1.3 (1999/03/31)
easymat A simple package for writing matrices.
Treats a matrix as an array enviroment with more kinds of lines and reentrant. See also easy
license: lppl version: 0.3 (1999/03/31)
easytable A simple package for writing tables.
Supports tables with equal column widths or equal rows heights or both, with various kinds of rules (lines) between rows and columns using an array/tabular-like syntax. See also easy
license: lppl version: 0.9 (1998/08/18)
easyvector Write vectors in a C-like fashion.
See also easy
license: lppl version: 0.9 (1997/11/18)
ec No caption.
The European Computer Modern Fonts supporting the complete LaTeX T1 encoding defined at the 1990 TUG conference hold at Cork/Ireland. These fonts are intended to be stable with no changes being made to the tfm files. Also contains a Text Companion Symbol font, called tc, featuring many useful characters needed in typesetting, for example oldstyle digits, currency symbols (including the newly created Euro symbol), the permille sign, copyright, trade mark and servicemark as well as a copyleft sign, and many others. Recent releases of LaTeX2e support the ec fonts. The ec fonts supersede the preliminary version released as the dc fonts. See also eurosym
license: lppl (1999/03/03)
ecc No caption.
The MetaFont sources and tfm files of the European Concrete Fonts. This is the EC implementation of Knuth's Concrete fonts, including also the corresponding text companion fonts. See also ccfonts
license: lppl (1999/03/03)
ecltree No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
eco No caption.
A set of font metric files and virtual fonts for using the ec fonts with oldstyle numerals. These files can only be used together with the standard ec fonts. The style file eco.sty is sufficient to use the eco fonts but if you intend to use other font families as well, e.g., PostScript fonts, try altfont .
license: unknown version: 1.2 (1998/07/22)
ecpk No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
ec-plain No caption.
A plain-like format using the ec fonts including an extended math italic font (exmi) providing upright greek letters.
license: unknown (1998/04/21)
edmac No caption.
A macro package for typesetting scholarly critical editions.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
eepic No caption.
Extensions to epic and the LaTeX picture drawing environment, including the drawing of lines at any slope, the drawing of circles in any radii, and the drawing of dotted and dashed lines much faster with much less TeX memory, and providing several new commands for drawing ellipses, arcs, splines, and filled circles and ellipses.
license: dfsg (1998/12/28)
egplot No caption.
A package to encapsulate gnuplot commands in a LaTeX source file and thus include figures generated with gnuplot.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
eiad Macros and EIAD fonts.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
eijkhout No caption.
Several unrelated packages: DBprocess, to parse and process database output; CDlabeler, to typeset user text to fit on a CD label; repeat.tex, a nestable, generic loop macro.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
elsevier Preprint style for Elsevier Science journals.
license: nosell (1999/03/03)
elvish Font for typesetting Tolkien Elvish script.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
emp No caption.
A package for encapsulated MetaPost pictures in LaTeX. Useful for keeping illustrations in sync with the text. It also frees the user from inventing descriptive names for PostScript files that fit into the confines of file system conventions.
license: dfsg (1999/03/03)
emtex A TeX system for MS-DOS.
license: nosell (1999/04/14)
emtexgi A MS-Windows interface to emTeX.
license: unknown (1997/01/12)
emtex-os2 A TeX system for os2.
license: unknown (1998/07/31)
emtextds No caption.
An emtex-based TeX system for OS/2 Warp with a TDS-compliant directory structure. The distribution contains a full texmf directory tree. Installing emTeX/TDS requires the original emtex collection and the dvips archive dvips576.zip.
license: unknown (1998/09/30)
emulateapj No caption.
LaTeX style files to produce preprints with the page layout similar to that of the Astrophysical Journal.
license: lppl (1999/03/03)
encodings No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
endfloat No caption.
Place all figures on pages by themselves at the end of the document with markers like ``[Figure 3 about here]'' appearing in the text (by default) near to where the figure (or table) would normally have occurred.
license: dfsg (1996/06/21)
endnotes No caption.
Accumulates footnotes and places them at the end of the document. See also fnpara footmisc footnpag
license: dfsg (1998/02/4)
engwar No caption.
Font for typesetting Tolkien Engwar script, by Michael Urban.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
enumerate No caption.
Adds an optional argument to the enumerate environment which determines the style in which the counter is printed.
license: unknown (1998/07/22)
envbig Printing addresses on envelopes.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
envlab No caption.
A LaTeX2e package for producing mailing envelopes and labels, including barcodes and address formatting according to the US Postal Service rules. Redefines the standard \makelabels command of the LaTeX2e letter documentclass. See also akletter brief dinbrief formlett
license: unknown version: 1.2 (1999/03/03)
epic A package enhancing LaTeX's picture mode.
See also eepic
license: dfsg (1998/07/24)
epigraph A package for typesetting epigraphs.
Epigraphs are the pithy quotations often found at the start (or end) of a chapter. Both single epigraphs and lists of epigraphs are catered for. Various aspects are easily configurable.
license: lppl (1998/12/1)
eplain No caption.
Simple but powerful extended version of the plain format, adding support for bibliographies, tables of contents, enumerated lists, verbatim input of files, numbered equations, tables, two-column output, footnotes and commutative diagrams.
license: dfsg (1996/08/19)
epmtfe TeX environment for OS/2.
The EPM TeX Front End is an additional module for the OS/2 `Enhanced Editor' (EPM), v6.03, turning the editor into a powerful integrated TeX environment that can be used in conjunction with emTeX or another OS/2 TeX system.
license: dfsg version: 2.4 (1999/05/13)
epsfig Include Encapsulated PostScript in LaTeX documents.
Superseded by the LaTeX2e graphics package.
license: unknown (1 Apr 1991)
epsfx No caption.
An extension to epsf.tex/sty dvips macros, e.g., draft printing of bounding boxes.
license: pd version: 0.59 (1999/03/03)
epslatex No caption.
An extensive document which explains how to use Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) files in LaTeX2e documents. Includes explanations of Bounding Boxes, and more. See also fepslatex
license: unknown version: 2.0 (15/12/97) (1998/02/9)
eqname Style for different equation numbering.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
eqnarray More generalised equation arrays with numbering.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
esieecv Curriculum vit for French.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
esindex Typset index entries in Spanish documents.
license: lppl (1998/11/10)
eso-pic A package to add picture commands to every page.
license: unknown (1998/07/22)
et No caption.
A program to edit TeX files in a semi-WYSIWYG fashion on IBM-type PC's.
license: unknown (1998/02/24)
etexbase No description available.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
ethiop No caption.
Ethiopian language support for the babel package, including a collection of fonts and TeX macros for typesetting the characters of the languages of Ethiopia, with fonts based on EthTeX originally distributed by Abass B. Alamnehe.
license: gpl version: 0.7 (1999/03/03)
etruscan Fonts for the Etruscan script.
The Etruscan was in use between approximately 1000 BC to 100 AD. The font comes in mirrored forms suitable for writing either left-to-right or right-to-left (as the Etruscans did)
license: lppl (1999/03/26)
euler No caption.
Provides a setup for using the AMS Euler family of fonts for math in LaTeX documents. ``The underlying philosophy of Zapf's Euler design was to capture the flavor of mathematics as it might be written by a mathematician with excellent handwriting.'' [concrete-tug] The euler package is based on Knuth's macros for the book ``Concrete Mathematics''. The text fonts for the Concrete book are provided by the beton package. See also beton
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
euro Arbitrary national currency amounts using the Euro as base unit.
This package converts arbitrary national currencyamounts using the Euro as base unit, and typesets monetary amounts inalmost any desired way. Write, e.g., \ATS{17.6} to get something like`17,60 \"oS (1,28 Euro)' automatically. Conversion rates for theso-called Euro-zone countries are already built-in. Further rates canbe added easily.
license: lppl version: 0.2 (1999/05/17)
euro2 National and Euro currancy.
This package typesets national currency values and their Euro values automatically and in customizable format.
license: unknown (1999/03/26)
eurofont Provides a command that prints a euro symbol.
The particular symbol printed by \euro will in general change depending on the font family, weight, and shape in use at the time. This symbol can come from any source, and the package user has complete control over which euro symbol is used in any given situation. The package is pre-configured to behave sensibly with many common text fonts and available euro symbols. The \euro command can print `faked' euro symbols from a C with two lines across it when no suitable real euro symbol is available; the package also includes code for printing fake bold euro symbols for use when no real bold symbol exists, as well as pre-configured support for a faked italic version of the marvosym font. Eurofont comes set up to use euro symbols from Adobe's Eurofonts, the marvosym font, the Eurosym font, and any available Text Companion fonts. The selection between these can be done using options passed to the package. The eurofont package knows about the China2e font's euro symbol, and can be configured to use it. See also eurosym marvosym
license: unknown version: 1.1.3 (1999/03/03)
europs No caption.
Provides access to Adobe's Euro currency symbol fonts from LaTeX. The fonts are named using Karl Berry's naming scheme, providing fd files and a style file to use the fonts directly, and providing four macros: \EURtm, \EURhv, \EURcr and \EUR (from marvosym ). The actual symbol they produce depends on the currently active font, i.e., they follow font changes caused by \text.. and other NFSS commands. The actual fonts are not included as they have to be fetched from Adobe's web or ftp server. See also eurosym marvosym
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
eurosans Interface to Adobe's free Euro fonts.
Provides a convenient interface for using the free Adobe Euro fonts in (PostScript) format. Loading the package defines a new command \euro which typesets a Euro symbol. The symbol is always taken from the `EuroSans' family, with the weight (medium or boldface) and shape (normal or oblique) varying according to the font currently selected. This Euro symbol meets the official design and matches almost any font family very well, except for typewriter fonts.
license: lppl version: 1.0 (1999/05/13)
eurosym No caption.
The new European currency symbol for the ``Euro'' implemented in Metafont, using the official European Commission dimensions, and providing several shapes (normal, slanted, bold, outline). The package also includes a LaTeX style file which defines the macro , pre-compiled tfm files, and documentation. See also europs marvosym
license: unknown version: 1.2 (1999/01/6)
euxm No caption.
Like EUSM but with two more characters needed for Concrete Math
license: unknown (1999/03/31)
everysel A LaTeX package which provides hooks into selectfont.
license: lppl version: 1.02 (1999/03/03)
everyshi Introduces a new hook for taking action at every \shipout.
Introduces a new hook for taking action at every \shipout.
license: lppl version: 2.02 (1999/03/03)
exam Package for typesetting exam scripts.
license: unknown version: 3.30 (1998/12/16)
examdesign Package for typesetting exams.
license: unknown (1998/01/20)
exams No caption.
Exam questions can be multiple choice or free form long/short answer questions. Options include the typesetting of the exam itself, an exam showing all the answers and a collection of questions and answers. Questions can be parameterized. Use of a random generator provides for automatic shuffling of multiple choice items. See also answers
license: unknown (1996/05/29)
excalibur No caption.
A spelling checker for the Macintosh that is also LaTeX aware.
license: unknown (1998/11/8)
expdlist Expanded description environments.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
expl3 No caption.
Experimental packages to allow experienced TeX programmers to experiment with, and comment on, a proposed set of syntax conventions and basic data-types that might form the basis for programming large scale projects in TeX.
license: unknown (1998/06/1)
export No caption.
This package allows the user to export/import the values of LaTeX registers (counters, rigid and rubber lengths only). It is definitely NOT for faint-hearted users.
license: unknown (1999/03/03)
exscale Implements scaling of the `cmex' fonts.
See also sauterfonts
license: unknown (1996/06/12)
extdash No caption.
Implements the commands \Hyphdash, \Endash, \Emdash, and their *-forms, to control hyphenation of compound words and ordinary words dashed by em-dash. You can also use the shortcuts \-/, \=/, \--, \==, \---, and \=== instead.
license: unknown (1998/12/28)
